column4: ok anyone know what device files the most recent ubuntu uses to access the ide drives, it used to be hdX then scdX, whats it now tho ?
im trying to help someone install new ubuntu, they cant find the cdrom device, and no /dev/sd* either :(
wat point are they up to?
so i there an install icon and is he double clicking it and are you with him?
i installed it on a p111 886 mhz today
but it was reasonably slow to install and while it only had 128mb ram it used a pre-existing swap file to get through  its labours
is he saying its installing now?
let me boot up a livecd here and let me see if i can see this cdrom setup
you comfirm that cd is mounted on /media/cdrom and from dev/sdXX ?
the cdrom appears / is mounted at/in the livecd filestructure at /cdrom
no idea but i am puzzled as to why he wants to access it .....
think he is wasting his time there in the sense tht  i dont think that version is no longer supported
